title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
The SEC has opened an investigation into electric delivery-truck maker Workhorse, which was an early investor in now-struggling startup Lordstown Motors.

OPEC and a group of Russia-led producers said they agreed to continue increasing oil production in measured steps.

The SEC sued BitConnect and its founder, alleging a $2 billion fraud that misused bitcoin raised from investors world-wide.

Amazon said it is seeking to hire about 55,000 people globally for corporate and tech roles during a recruiting event set for Sept. 15.

The Nasdaq rose 0.3% to a record, while the S&P 500 inched up 0.03%. The Dow slipped 0.1%.

Factory activity faltered across Asia in August, with a resurgence in Covid-19 infections adding to global supply-chain disruptions.

Apple is working on new health-related features for its smartwatch.
